title: [K-12] Theory-Driven Instructional Design Research Methods Practice: Application to Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of foundational math concepts and core principles of instructional design
context.additional_context: Acquiring theory-practice integrated instructional design methods in smartphone-based real-time classroom settings

learning_goals: Learners can apply a design-based research methodology grounded in educational theory following a three-stage experimental procedure.
Learners can develop a framework for systematically documenting learner interaction data generated during iterative design processes.
Learners can derive at least two prototype theories applicable to mathematics education settings.

resources: Open Educational Content Library for Mathematics Instruction
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
